key_channel_insights.line_content: The OTA channel recorded 91.1% price parity last week with Cathay Pacific’s website, reflecting a consistent uplift in alignment and reduced premium listings.
Metasearch engines offered lower fares on 77.4% of itineraries, with discounts deepening by 2.35 pp month-over-month and a narrow average gap of 0.08% driving consumer appeal.
The GDS channel achieved 95.51% parity last week with minimal price deviations and improved route coverage, underscoring its reliability for consistent pricing.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA channel achieved 91.1% price parity last week, up 1.98 pp week-over-week and 1.19 pp month-over-month, reflecting tighter alignment with Cathay Pacific’s website.
Listings where the OTA was higher dropped to 5.84% of itineraries, down 2.33 pp week-over-week and 1.30 pp month-over-month, showing improved consistency.
Instances of lower OTA fares remain negligible at 0.45%, with an average discount of just 0.07%, while missing offers account for only 2.58% of routes.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Last-week missing offer rate stood at 2.58%, rising modestly by 0.46 pp from the prior week and by 0.24 pp from last month.
Parity reached 91.13% last week, up from 89.15% the week before and 89.94% month-to-date, demonstrating a clear upward trend.
The share of routes where the OTA is more expensive fell to 5.84%, down from 8.17% week-over-week and from 7.13% month-over-month.
Routes where the OTA undercuts the website remain rare at 0.45%, edging down from 0.56% in the prior week and 0.58% last month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul parity improved to 89.97% last week (+2.52 pp), with OTA-higher listings shrinking to 6.87% (−2.95 pp).
Long-haul routes maintain very high parity at 96.32%, with minimal OTA-higher (1.23%) and OTA-lower (0.61%) frequencies.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: HK departures show near-perfect alignment with 96.83% parity, virtually zero higher-fare instances (0.23%) and equally rare undercuts (0.23%).
Non-HK markets saw parity climb to 85.52% (+3.97 pp), though 11.36% of itineraries remain pricier on OTAs despite a 4.64 pp drop.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in fares exhibit 90.85% parity (+1.90 pp), with OTA-higher listings at 4.99% (−2.38 pp) and OTA-lower at 0.33%.
Far-out bookings reached 91.72% parity (+1.83 pp), while OTA-higher premiums hold at 7.59% (−2.18 pp) and undercuts at 0.69%.

mse_highlights.line_content: Last week, 77.4% of itineraries on MSE were priced below Cathay Pacific’s website rates, underscoring the channel’s role as a primary source of discounted fares.
The share of lower-priced MSE itineraries increased by 0.57 pp week-over-week and by 2.35 pp month-over-month, highlighting a steady deepening of metasearch discounts.
Average MSE fares were 0.08% below website levels last week, indicating narrow but consistent price separation that could drive conversion via perceived savings.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 77.44% of itineraries on MSE were lower-priced last week, up 0.57 pp from the previous week and 2.35 pp month-over-month, with an average fare differential of −0.08% versus the website.
22.45% of itineraries matched website prices last week, down 0.57 pp week-over-week and 2.35 pp month-over-month, confirming stable parity presence.
0.11% of itineraries lacked MSE offers last week, showing no change week-over-week or month-over-month, indicating minimal coverage gaps.
No itineraries on MSE were priced higher than the website last week, reflecting an absence of premium pricing in this distribution channel.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul itineraries saw 73.35% of fares priced lower on MSE last week, down 0.22 pp week-over-week but up 1.33 pp month-over-month, with an average discount of 0.08%.
Long-haul itineraries exhibited 95.71% lower fares on MSE last week, up 3.78 pp week-over-week and 7.10 pp month-over-month, achieving an average 0.06% price reduction.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Hong Kong origin itineraries registered 81.00% of fares lower on MSE last week, rising 1.94 pp week-over-week and 3.40 pp month-over-month, with an average 0.09% savings.
Non-HK origins had 73.94% of itineraries lower-priced on MSE last week, slightly down 0.89 pp week-over-week but up 1.32 pp month-over-month, with average savings of 0.06%.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings saw 78.20% of fares lower on MSE last week, up 0.98 pp week-over-week and 2.71 pp month-over-month, at an average 0.09% discount.
Far-out bookings had 75.86% of itineraries discounted on MSE last week, down 0.23 pp week-over-week but up 1.62 pp month-over-month, with an average 0.06% price reduction.

gds_highlights.line_content: 95.51% of GDS fares matched website prices last week, up 1.66 pp week-on-week and 1.24 pp month-on-month, underscoring strong price alignment.
Only 0.34% of fares were higher on GDS (avg +0.11%) and 0.90% were lower (avg −0.05%) last week, indicating tight margin control.
Routes unavailable on GDS fell to 3.26% last week, a 1.89 pp reduction from the prior week and 1.30 pp month-on-month, reflecting enhanced coverage.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 3.26% of itineraries were missing on GDS last week, down 1.89 pp week-on-week and 1.30 pp month-on-month, indicating improved availability.
95.51% of fares were identical to the website last week, rising 1.66 pp from the previous week and 1.24 pp from last month, demonstrating stable parity.
0.34% of routes were priced higher on GDS last week with a modest 0.11% average increase, unchanged week-on-week and 0.01 pp lower month-on-month.
0.90% of routes were cheaper on GDS last week, up 0.23 pp week-on-week and 0.08 pp month-on-month, with an average discount of 0.05%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw matched fares climb 2.55 pp to 95.32% last week while GDS unavailability dropped to 3.71%, signaling better alignment.
Long-haul parity eased by 1.83 pp to 96.32% as unavailability rose to 1.84%, and GDS higher pricing increased to 1.23%, highlighting slight divergence.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: HK-origin routes maintained 98.87% parity with negligible price deltas and only 0.68% unavailability, reflecting consistent GDS performance.
Non-HK origins saw matched fares rise 3.73 pp to 91.98% and listings missing decline to 6.01%, while discounts on GDS edged up to 1.56%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings achieved 97.67% parity (up 2.52 pp) and reduced unavailability to 1.50%, with higher-priced cases steady at 0.33%.
Far-out bookings saw parity dip 0.21 pp to 91.03% as unavailability eased to 6.90% and lower-priced cases jumped 1.05 pp to 1.72%.
